alert.note: Alert for Clay; Quitman; Randolph (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Clay, northwestern Randolph and Quitman Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Georgetown to 7 miles northwest of Cuthbert to near Preston. Movement was southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cuthbert, Georgetown, Wire Bridge, Bonapartes Retreat, Watson Crossroads, Crossroads, Ricks Place, Randolph Co A/p, Hatcher, Morris, Bethel, Benevolence, Springvale, Cotton Hill, Wades, Days Crossroads, Springvale Station, Peterson Hill, Coles and White House. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
